the Google Play Developer Distribution Agreement requires that you grant your users a "nonexclusive, worldwide, and perpetual license to perform, display, and use the Product on the Device." \nYou could cover this in the End-User License Agreement (EULA) or cover it in your Terms and Conditions agreement along with other clauses that are useful for your Android app.
